intro: Rubus rusticanus subsp. striatus, commonly known as the striated blackberry, is a shrub native to parts of North America. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that ripen to a dark purple or black color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. The subspecies is distinguished by its distinctive leaf venation and slightly different fruit structure compared to other Rubus species.
